3: On the desert wasteland, jagged rock formations jut out of the ground through which the Red Tide flows.
Wanshi squats on a towering rock formation.
The Red Tide quietly trickles below.
Although the tide here occasionally swells, it's not an unstoppable force like previous accounts in the city ruins.
Occasionally, he sees strange debris, rusty metal, shredded rubber, and even pale animal bones floating in the red ichor.
There doesn't seem to be any fear in Wanshi. He just lets out a big yawn instead.
Ugh...
How much longer do I gotta wait?
On the rugged surface of the rock, there is not a flat enough space to place the tripod for his sniper rifle.
Well—the latest information should have been uploaded to Babylonia. What's taking them so long?
I don't know what's going on with the Captain either.
I'm always left to do all the recon work here. Now I'm stuck between a rock and a hard place...
If they don't dispatch any reinforcements, this place is gonna...
The Red Tide tributary had only just reached this place twenty-four hours ago.
But now, aside from only the tallest of rocks, the entire area has been completely flooded.

Fortunately, the Red Tide is only quietly flowing and not surging out of control. The rock on which he stands still towers high above. The Inver-Device and protective equipment strengthened by the Support Force on such short notice enable him to make observations from a relatively safe distance without fear of corruption.

However, this cannot continue much longer. It was only a sparse Red Tide tributary not long ago. Now it has completely inundated the area. Even if he proceeds with caution, he is better off leaving this area sooner rather than later.
Not only is the Punishing Virus concentration rising, the Red Tide also brings 'life'—life to the Punishing Virus.
The Red Tide surging below the rock is a breeding ground for Hetero-Creatures.
Large red crystal clusters, like reeds and shrubs, surround the trickling tide. Red creatures of various shapes and sizes pass between them.
These creatures are neither corrupted machines nor Constructs.
These Hetero-Creatures glowing with a red aura are merely vestiges of life on Earth that had been devoured by the Red Tide.
On the 'riverbank,' Wanshi catches a glimpse of a motionless stone suddenly crack as four limbs protrude from within.
Wanshi's bionic skin quickly calculates the current wind speed.
1.6 meters per second. Wind blowing from 4 o'clock.
My sniper scope should move a notch right to compensate for the wind.
Slightly leaning to the side, the crosshairs in the narrow scope moves one mil to the right.
Ready. Aim. Fire... Bullseye.
The bullet releases from the chamber, landing a direct hit on the Hetero-Creature.

The Hetero-Creature collapses onto the ground, writhes in pain, then becomes limp and lifeless. Soon after, the overflowing Red Tide reclaims it into nutrients for the Hetero-Creatures to spawn from within.
Yawn... There's no end to them...
Setting down his sniper rifle, Wanshi takes out his rangefinder binoculars and looks in the direction of the extending tributary.
This rock is about 20 meters in height. Without obstacles and regardless of meteorological conditions, the maximum distance that can be visually measured should be...
Wanshi closes his eyes for a brief second before arriving at a conclusion.
17 km.
However, the rangefinder can no longer see the end of the tributary.
In other words, the Red Tide tributary currently flowing below is extending at a speed of more than 17 kilometers a day.
...Looks like this is no laughing matter.
He puts away the rangefinder, then stands up.
Suddenly, the deafening roar of motors rumbles in the sky above.
Wanshi quickly looks up. His drowsy eyes suddenly open wide.
Huh... I don't believe it.
Shooting stars aren't visible during the day.
But in Wanshi's golden eyes, he sees the vivid reflection of a metallic 'meteor' followed by a long trail of black smoke as it descends to Earth.

Attention passengers. The aircraft will begin to decelerate and reduce orbital altitude. Reverse thrusters will ignite in fifteen seconds. Rapid deceleration will generate 2 G's of force. Please fasten your seat belts.
Attention passengers. The aircraft is approaching the ionosphere. Entering communication blackout for 67 seconds. All departments have switched to onboard wired communication.

Attention passengers. The aircraft is approaching the mesosphere. Preparing to shut down the aerospace engine and switch to the aircraft engine. Please fasten your seat belts and brace for turbulence.
Attention passengers. The aircraft has entered the inner atmosphere. Initiating aviation procedure.
Attention passengers. The aircraft has entered the stratosphere.
Attention passengers. The aircraft has entered the troposphere.
Attention passengers. Due to impaired visibility from the current sandstorm, the system is unable to confirm the location of the Red Tide.
The system can't detect the Red Tide? Then we must proceed according to the original plan.
Our mission starts now. Disperse and proceed with your duties. I wish you all the best in completing the mission.
That was fast...
The sudden tremor of the aircraft's hull made every passenger's heart skip a beat.
The violent shaking catches you off guard, causing your head to bang against the hull of the aircraft.
Normally, you would be able to stabilize yourself. However, your consciousness becomes shrouded in darkness before you are able to adjust your posture in time.
During a 'memory playback,' you will be completely pulled into a memory spiral. This overload of information will make you unable to control your body and perceive what is happening around you.
Fortunately, the playbacks dissipate as fast as they manifest. You may recount a certain duration of time subjectively, but only a few seconds may pass in real-time.
By the way, during this period, your subconscious will become hyperactive.
You may be overcome with perplexing ideas and make bewildering decisions.
That's because your brain processes a lot of information internally, but your subjective thinking can't keep up with this processing speed.
I can't say for sure whether this will have a positive or negative impact.

However, it's worth noting that the situation on the battlefield can change at a moment's notice. Since your 'memory playbacks' are unpredictable and beyond your control, they may prove fatal in battle.
To be on the safe side, I advise against participating in battles that require direct confrontation with the enemy for the time being.
Just as you pull yourself out of a memory playback...
The metal hull rapidly approaches.
You struggle to avoid the collision, but you cannot even lift a finger.
You can only succumb to the whim of your memories.
It's been quite some time, Gray Raven Commandant.
Surprised to see me, I take it?
To be honest, it took quite some effort to reach you. If Chairman Allen hadn't lobbied for me, I don't think this would be possible.
The task forces have all heard about the heroic deeds of the Gray Ravens at the Ascendants' base. I've even heard about them in Babylonia!
If you've been in direct contact with the Ascendants, have you seen the Ascendant who attacked me on the space station?
Never mind, he's not important. The only thing I care about is whether you found any sign of her in their base...
Just as the pink-haired girl is about to say a name...
Your memory stops and then cuts to black as if it had been tampered with.
Severe pain fills your head, and your thoughts stagnate for a moment.
Commandant!

2: Sorry, I was lost in thought...
4: Liv, no need to get up.

3: Tch! It's turbulence. Stay put!
But, Commandant... Your head...
Attention passengers, the aircraft is experiencing turbulence. Attempting to stabilize altitude. Please stay seated so as not to change the aircraft's center of gravity.
Thunderstorms rumble outside of the transport craft. Electric arcs flash among the clouds, shaking everyone with an even more violent tremor.
Experiencing excessive turbulence. Attempting to disengage by expediting the descent sequence. Please do not panic.
No, in a situation like this that won't—
The turbulence continues to escalate.
Due to the emergency maneuver, the aircraft has deviated from the original target. The aircraft is still experiencing turbulence.
Turbulence has deformed the portside wing due to excessive load-bearing. Aerodynamics compromised. Initiating emergency landing procedure.
The sharp crunch of the portside wing proves to be the final blow to the transport craft as half of the deformed wing plummets to the ground.
The aircraft cannot return to a stable attitude for landing. Estimating ground impact of approximately 15 °. At this angle, the aircraft is at risk of crash landing.
Initiating parachute evacuation procedure. Depressurizing cabin. Opening tailgate in fifteen seconds.
Tailgate open. All personnel, please parachute out immediately.
The initial impact against the hull nearly knocks you unconscious, and you struggle to move.
Descending into a tailspin, the blood on your forehead blurs your vision.
The seat belt is now proving to be a death sentence. Perhaps due to the impact, repeated attempts to release the seat belt are all in vain.
Asimov was right. During a 'memory playback,' you are but a lamb to the slaughter.
In the dim haze of light, you catch a glimpse of Construct teams evacuating the aircraft one after another.
Hurry up and prepare for evacuation...
Right as you stand up, the cabin shakes violently again.
I've secured a bit domain node. When will we parachute out?
Too late. The transport craft has stalled!
It's too dangerous to parachute now. Brace for impact, Lucia! Help the commandant!
Got it!
Right as you're about to crash into the metal hull again, someone shields your head and pulls you into their embrace.
The embrace is cold and familiar.
I've got you, Commandant. Don't worry.
I'll protect you.
Some time later...
Maybe it was just a few seconds. Maybe it was quite some time.
When all the dust settled, the 'forced landing' was closer to a 'crash landing.'
You hear the sound of a laser cutting metal by your ears.
You opened your eyes slightly to see Lee cutting away the hull.
Don't move, Commandant.
In a rare tone of sternness, Liv stops you as you prepare to move.
Lee kicks open the crumbling metal hull that had been cut.
At that moment, light from the sky pours into the cabin.
Hurry, Lucia. Get the commandant out.
Lucia removes you from the transport craft.
Looking around, you find the three Constructs unfazed. Your wounded forehead is the only sign of damage.
Lucia, set the commandant down. I'll apply emergency aid.
Alright.
Having experience as a former medic, Liv quickly stems the bleeding and bandages your wounds.
Fortunately, it's just a flesh wound. It just looks more serious than what it actually is.
Eyebrows furrowed, Lucia lets out a sigh of relief off to the side, then draws her weapon and looks around vigilantly.
Now is not the time to let our guard down.
Watch your surroundings.
Surrounded by barren wasteland, the crash site must be far off the beaten path leading to the original destination.
If it is just an ordinary wasteland, it would not have mattered... More importantly, however, was where the crew had crash-landed...
What's that?!
To everyone's surprise, the crash site is not just some remote location. Rather, it is amidst the tributaries of the Red Tide.
More aptly put, they are at the bar to the tributaries. Though they are not inundated by the Red Tide, they are by no means out of harm's way.
Sand billowing in the wind impairs visibility, making movement in any direction nigh impossible.
...! What's that sound?
The sound is rich and melodious, like the call of a large mammal.
As the sound becomes louder and louder, a rustling approaches from the depths of the sandstorm.
In a flash, the three Gray Ravens stand in front to protect you.
